name: incredulity
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the feeling of not wanting or not being able to believe something: He felt a sense of incredulity, anger, and pain at the accusation made against him. A lot of people expressed incredulity that somebody of her age would want to die. See
incredulous
More examplesFewer examplesShe broke off when she saw the look of utter incredulity on Matt's face.Louisa uttered some words of incredulity and surprise.There was widespread incredulity that a junior employee could have racked up such huge losses without the knowledge of his superiors.
